main event: Two disc-shaped objects were observed hovering in the southwest sky over Lynchburg, Virginia on 8 Jan 1965.
interesting points: The objects were silver in color and approximately 60-80 feet in diameter., They were observed for about 5 minutes before accelerating rapidly and disappearing from view., The objects moved silently and smoothly with no visible means of propulsion., The sighting was corroborated by several additional witnesses from various locations in Lynchburg., The report concluded with the case closed, indicating no further details were available.
witness description: military aircraft crew (two pilots, one observer) and additional witnesses
